paper_abstract: We revisit the communication-efficient three-party password authenticated key exchange protocol recently proposed by Chang et al. We show it is insecure against partition attacks, whereby the adversary can guess the correct password off-line. Thereafter we propose an enhanced protocol that can resist the attack described and yet is quite efficient. Furthermore, we prove its security in a widely accepted model. (C) 2012 Elsevier Inc. All rights reserved.
paper_title: Cryptanalysis of a communication-efficient three-party password authenticated key exchange protocol
